image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing a black blazer and blue shirt sits inside in front of a window, talking to a woman.

props.synopsis: The recent by-election loss in Adelaide's south comes just eight months after another party blow â€” the loss of former premier Steven Marshall's seat of Dunstan.

title.children: After losing two by-elections in eight months, can the SA Liberal Party find its way out of the opposition wilderness?

image.altText: A man touching part of a gate which has a butterfly design on it

props.synopsis: Steel fabricator Scott Campbell fondly remembers the "dying art" of working iron into unique shapes, a craft popularised in the outback city in the 1950s by the man who began the business Mr Campbell now owns more than six decades later.

title.children: Preserving the 'dying art' of wrought iron metalwork

image.altText: Mark McEachern has short grey hair, he wears a navy blue police uniform and stands in front of a bench with microphones.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old woman, who police allege was babysitting the boy and his little brother, has been charged with criminal neglect. Police believe the child may have been previously assaulted by others at the home and are appealing to the public for information. Warning: This story contains details that readers may find distressing.

title.children: Toddler still recovering from suspicious injuries allegedly sustained in September, police say

image.altText: Dakota Davidson raises her arms in front of another woman wearing Lions uniform, on a blurred background

props.synopsis: Brisbane will take on North Melbourne in the AFLW grand final after consigning Adelaide to a third straight preliminary final defeat.

title.children: Lions mow down Crows to storm into AFLW grand final showdown against Roos

image.altText: A sign at the Women's and Children's Hospital in North Adelaide.

props.synopsis: The number of families who have been paid compensation over SA's cochlear implant programming error has risen to 141.

title.children: Two more families impacted by cochlear implant bungle

image.altText: A net in a body of water with a hand above it holding little pieces of an aquatic plant.

props.synopsis: Duckweed is an abundant plant in many parts of the world and researchers are testing if it can be grown in space.

title.children: Australian researchers send duckweed to space in hunt for food to fuel interplanetary travellers

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: A royal commission has heard a lack of services vital to collecting evidence of sexual assault in regional South Australia has resulted in some victim-survivors walking away from potential prosecutions of perpetrators.

title.children: Sexual assault victim-survivors had to travel long distance for medical examinations, royal commission hears

image.altText: A baby wearing pink lies on her stomach on white sheets.

props.synopsis: A father who killed his baby daughter at the Whispering Wall had told his ex-partner that he wanted to take Kobi to the tourist attraction months before the murder-suicide, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Baby Kobi's father mentioned murder-suicide location to mother in phone call months before, an inquest has heard

image.altText: About 100 people in colourful kayaks and canoes in front of a bulk carrier

props.synopsis: NSW Police say they've arrested 138 protesters in Newcastle Harbour for allegedly blocking the shipping channel in the world's largest coal port.

title.children: More than 100 arrested during anti-coal protest in Newcastle Harbour as shipping movements paused

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt holds a glass beaker full of water in front of his face.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide-based aquaculture company hopes to use saline groundwater to grow the products at a landlocked site in South Australia's Riverland.Â

title.children: Ocean fish and seaweed to be farmed hundreds of kilometres inland using salt water from deep underground

image.altText: A man standing in front of vine leaves making a gesture with his hands on top of each other

props.synopsis: The fatal stabbing of Ngor Bol in Adelaide's CBD has prompted members of the victim's family to move back to their home countries because they no longer feel safe in Australia, a court has heard.

title.children: Murder of young man slain by 'truly evil' killers prompts family to leave Australia for safety reasons, court told

image.altText: Portraits of three women on top of a volleyball court.

props.synopsis: Former members of the Australian womenâ€™s indoor volleyball team have outlined allegations of harm while training for the Sydney Olympics. Players are speaking out for the first time after Volleyball Australia apologised for an "environment of fear".

title.children: 'Deep down I was broken': Former Australian volleyball players speak up about 'environment of fear' at the AIS

image.altText: A picture of the Google Chrome logo surrounded by coding text.

props.synopsis: US regulators are taking legal action against the tech giant, saying Google's browser has too much power.

title.children: Google could be forced to sell Chrome. What could that mean for the internet?

image.altText: Yashasvi Jaiswal celebrates with his arms aloft after reaching a century

props.synopsis: Yashasvi Jaiswal leads the Indian assault on Australia's tiring bowling attack on day three of the first Test at Perth Stadium. Follow live.

title.children: Jaiswal and India continue to pile on the runs as Australia turns to second new ball

image.altText: A young woman looking at the camera with blue sky in the background.

props.synopsis: Despite completing schooling in Australia, the children of asylum seekers are often counted as "international students" and cannot afford the fees to attend university.Â

title.children: Hooda would love to study nursing or become a police officer. Right now that's 'impossible'

image.altText: A shark and a car in a graphic showing the large size of the shark.

props.synopsis: A 5.62-metre great white female shark carrying four young pups was found dead on a regional Queensland drumline in August. She was the size of a dual-cab ute and scientists are now doing genetic studies on her body.

title.children: Researchers studying body of largest great white shark caught on a Queensland drumline

image.altText: Palestinian men standing in the middle of the rubble of destroyed buildings on a backdrop of other buildings

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for the terror organisation's armed wing says the female hostage died in northern Gaza, but Israel's military has been unable to verify the claim.

title.children: Israel says it can't 'confirm or refute' Hamas's claims that a hostage has died in Gaza

image.altText: Two women crying outside a court

props.synopsis: In a matter of days, two long-running Hong Kong court cases highlight just how much the semi-autonomous city is shrinking under Beijing's gaze.

title.children: One week in Hong Kong's courts has unveiled the true cost of speaking out against Beijing

image.altText: Karen Read wearing a checkered dress stares straight ahead while sitting in court.

props.synopsis: In a case that has scandalised a small town, fascinated true crime sleuths, and lured Netflix producers, Karen Read is a divisive figure. She is accused of killing her boyfriend, but her defence team argues she is the victim of a cover-up.

title.children: A late night out drinking ended in the death of a man in a blizzard. His girlfriend is accused of murder

image.altText: An aerial view of coal extracted from the Narrabri mine, with a landscape of lakes and mountains behind it.Â

props.synopsis: The federal government has been accused of politicising the Future Fund by changing its mandate, but its investments have always been tangled up in politics.

title.children: The Future Fund's investments are already politicised, but we pretend otherwise

image.altText: Street in Townsville

props.synopsis: Police are urgently searching for a group they allege broke into five vehicles, including an unmarked police car, and stole the weapon in the north Queensland city.

title.children: Four people on the run after allegedly stealing police firearm and ammunition in Townsville

image.altText: Ski jumper knocked off bench

props.synopsis: Norwegian ski jumper Kristoffer Eriksen Sundal was knocked off the starting bench unexpectedly at the FIS Ski Jumping World Cup in Lillehammer, but still leaped 134.5 metres.

title.children: 'This is a scandal': Ski jumper knocked off starting gate in Lillehammer

image.altText: EC Gildersleeve Morris working on an iPad and a laptop.

props.synopsis: As thousands of high school students across Australia anxiously await ATAR results, many first-year university applicants are finding other ways into their course of choice.

title.children: There's a better way than ATAR to get into university, according to more and more students

image.altText: Andy Murray and Novak Djokovic standing side by side smiling for a photo

props.synopsis: After the announcement, Andy Murray said he's looking forward to helping Novak Djokovic "achieve his goals".

title.children: Novak Djokovic hires old rival and longtime friend Andy Murray as coach for Australian Open

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

props.synopsis: An ongoing crisis has claimed eight Northern Territory lives in just five months, now Coroner Elisabeth Armitage is about to release a landmark report on the issues behind the human suffering.

title.children: Services 'drowning' in wake of 'epidemic' of violence as coroner prepares to release landmark report

image.altText: A plume of orange explosion flames erupting from the side of a multi-storey building as shadowed onlookers watch

props.synopsis: Lebanon's health ministry said Israeli air strikes on central Beirut killed at least four children in one of the deadliest attacks on the city since Israel began its assault against the Hezbollah terror group.

title.children: Lebanon says Israel 'bunker buster bombs' kill 20 in Beirut air strike

image.altText: A black and white photograph of George Pedley with the saucer nest in 1966.

props.synopsis: In 1966 a salt-of-the-earth banana farmer saw something he couldn't explain that left behind a circular mark in some reeds which he called a "saucer nest". That moment became the inspiration for an international alien hoax and exposed him to the chaotic debate about UFOs.

title.children: Family opens door to 60-year UFO mystery as public perceptions change

image.altText: Tom Gleeson stands at a podium with the Hard Quiz sign to his left.

props.synopsis: You better believe I'm here to judge you. Let's play â€¦ HARD!

title.children: Convinced you'd outperform my Hard Quiz contestants? Show us what you've got

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A woman is dead after an ATV rolled at a private property near Daylesford, north-west of Melbourne.

title.children: Woman killed in all-terrain vehicle crash

image.altText: The exterior of a broick building, a sign reading "Collinsville Connect Telecentre" on the left of the facade.

props.synopsis: Residents in the Queensland town of Collinsville say they can see a mobile tower from their home but struggle to make a phone call, so they rely on a free internet cafe to stay connected.

title.children: As this mining town swells, its mobile and internet services drop out â€” so it's down to the trusty internet cafe

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: The government of Laos breaks its silence over the deaths of six tourists from methanol poisoning, saying it is "profoundly saddened".

title.children: Laos government releases first statement after tourists' fatal methanol poisoning

image.altText: A young brown calf with a yellow number tag on it stands on hay-covered floor anbd walls, another calf behind.

props.synopsis: As young as one-day-old calves are removed from their mothers and killed. But now there is a push to stop the practice.Â

title.children: The dairy industry kills up to half a million calves each year. Some farmers say crossbreeding is a solution

image.altText: Victorious Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner shakes hands with Australia's Alex De Minaur at the net in the Davis Cup.

props.synopsis: Australia's hopes of reaching the Davis Cup final fall short after semi-final singles defeats for Alex de Minaur and Thanasi Kokkinakis against Italy.

title.children: Sinner downs Demon again as Australia's Davis Cup dream dies

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo, as Elphaba, and Ariana Grande, as Glinda, stare up above themselves in awe

props.synopsis: With Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo in starring roles, Wicked will be hoping for Barbie-like success at the box office. So it's no wonder its marketing rollout has parallels to last year's billion-dollar blockbuster.

title.children: Wicked tries to harness Barbie's marketing magic in the hopes of defying gravity at the box office
